The '''North Stair''' was an ancient stair cut by the [[Gondorians]]<ref name=UI>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''North Stair'', p. 346</ref> in the days of the great [[Kings of Gondor|kings]]<ref name=River>{{FR|River}}, p. 389</ref> of [[Gondor]]<ref name=Breaking>{{FR|Breaking}}, p. 402</ref> on the eastern side of the Falls of [[Rauros]] that went up from the [[Nindalf]] to the [[Emyn Muil]]<ref name=UI/> to carry boats between the lake of [[Nen Hithoel]] and [[Rauros-foot]],<ref name=River/> the basin at the foot of the [[Falls of Rauros]].<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Rauros-foot'', p. 346</ref>

When the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] was camped above [[Sarn Gebir]], [[Boromir]] objected to traveling across the lake, pretending that there was no way down past the falls. [[Aragorn]] sternly reminded him of the stairway and the possibility of carrying their boats to the lower river.<ref name=River/> Later, when the Company was awaiting [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]]'s decision at [[Parth Galen]], Aragorn spoke to the others about the great works of Gondor in the area, including the great Stair beside the falls of Rauros.<ref name=Breaking/>
